title: Why Man Utd blocked Jose Mourinho from completing £13.1m signing
text:
Jose Mourinho wanted Manchester United to sign Jerome Boateng (Getty Images)

Manchester United refused to sign Jerome Boateng during Jose Mourinho’s final summer at Old Trafford after using computer analysis to uncover weaknesses in the Bayern Munich defender, according to reports.

Mourinho was desperate for United to recruit a new central defender last year but ended the summer transfer window without a new arrival.

Boateng was on Mourinho’s shortlist and the Germany international even called the 56-year-old to thank him for his interest.

According to The Athletic, United had the chance to sign Boateng from Bayern for £13.1 million.

Jerome Boateng was available to Manchester United for £13.1m last year (Getty Images)

But the report claims that United used ‘bespoke software’ to spot a worrying trend in the defender’s game, which then prompted them to pull out of the deal.

United reportedly noticed that Boateng ‘tended to fade after 70 minutes’ during matches, leading to a reduction in tackles, interceptions and running statistics.

On that basis, United opted against adding Boateng to United’s squad, leaving Mourinho without the central defender he had request.

Mourinho was subsequently sacked that December, while United went on to pay a world-record £80 million fee to sign Harry Maguire from Leicester City this summer.
